title: 110_hr2507
content: The "Seniors Financial Security Act of 2007" repeals the inclusion of Social Security benefits and Tier 1 Railroad Retirement benefits in gross income. The "Seniors Financial Security Act of 2007" repeals the taxation of social security and tier 1 railroad retirement benefits under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Additionally, technical and conforming amendments are made to the treatment of workmen's compensation benefits under the Code. The workmen's compensation act is amended to define tier 1 railroad retirement benefits under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The amendment specifies the calculation of the annuity amount under the Railroad Retirement Act of 1974 based on Social Security Act entitlement. Amendments are made to various sections of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, including the repeal of certain clauses related to social security benefits and the taxation of such benefits by nonresident aliens. The repeal of certain clauses related to social security benefits and taxation by nonresident aliens, as well as amendments to withholding tax and returns for social security and railroad retirement benefits, are made to various sections of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The amendments made to various sections of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 include changes to disclosure rules, repealing subsection (k) of the Right to Financial Privacy Act of 1978, and updating tables of sections. These amendments apply to benefits received after December 31, 2006. The amendments made to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 include changes to disclosure rules and repealing subsection (k) of the Right to Financial Privacy Act of 1978. Appropriations are made for each fiscal year to fund under the Social Security Act or the Railroad Retirement Act of 1974 to offset reductions in transfers due to the amendments.
